name: The HBCU Trivia Game
description:
OFFICIAL SITE: https://www.hbcutriviagame.net/home-old

The HBCU Trivia Game is a trivia board game about Historically Black Colleges and Universities. The goals of this game are to promote our wonderful schools to college-bound youth, give alumni a fun way to reminisce and reflect on the good ole days of college, and show all that HBCUs are an excellent place to get a quality education.

By playing the game, participants will learn information about notable alumni, little known historical events, sports news, and fun facts! There are over 100 multiple choice/true-false questions about our schools and alumni!

The HBCU Trivia Game was developed by Maurice Jordan and Clarence Goss, Jr. Both are from North Carolina, graduates of HBCUs, and members of  Alpha Psi Fraternity, Inc. Jordan and Goss have traveled throughout the country to promote this highly anticipated product! Maurice Jordan is an alumnus of North Carolina Central University. Clarence Goss, Jr., is an alumnus of Elizabeth City State University.
